subject: Law
title: Environmental Law and AI
description: A micro-lesson that makes Environmental Law and AI usable.

hook.text: Training one AI model can emit as much CO2 as five cars in their lifetimes. Should AI have an environmental law?

buildup.text: AI's environmental impact includes energy use from data centers, water consumption for cooling, and electronic waste.

discovery.text: AI also helps: it optimizes energy grids, predicts wildfires, monitors deforestation, and models climate scenarios.

twist.text: No law requires disclosure of AI's environmental costs. Companies report revenue but not the carbon cost of training.

climax.text: The EU's AI Act and sustainability reporting rules may soon force tech companies to disclose AI's environmental impact.

punchline.text: AI can save the planet or strain it. The law hasn't decided which to regulate.

quiz.question: What environmental cost of AI is currently unregulated?
options: Energy and carbon emissions from training models
